text: a 2nd wood worker was working at home and started to feel the symptoms. performed the covid-19 test and the result was positive. a 2nd wood worker was working at home and started to feel the symptoms. performed the covid-19 test and the result was positive. the ip is symptomatic the employee is feeling symptoms such as body pain. the ip received guidance from the nursing technician regarding the necessary care and will be stay at home for quarantine period

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: pd; kiewit; minor damage to emergency light housing; ks-2016-0165 crew was moving an air conditioning unit into place when it came into contact with an emergency light fixture causing damage to light housing. work stopped and scene frozen. post incident protocols followed. investigation initiated.

ip tested positive for covid-19 o as part of tco's safeguarding practices for managing/monitoring covid-19, a sample screening took place for all personnel officed at the cc2 building at the client's pmt facility.  results identified psnk mac dcc employee was positive for covid-19 with no symptoms at the time of the test.  the local site team is undergoing a close contact practice in line with client requirements. ip is located at tco clinic. the case has been reported to psnk management. the local site team is undergoing a close contact practice in line with client requirements.

category: weather related issue, foot or leg injury
text: big flood at macaé yard, caused by a very heavy rain during the night migrated from legacy cairs incident #36594during last night (march 8th 2018), a very heavy rain has fallen in macaé and our yard was heavily flooded. first actions in the morning were to turn off the electrical energy, turn on pumps to remove the water and allow people to get into the yard to start cleaning and searching for material losses.nobody was injured on this flood inside of wood yard in macaé.. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description
person in camp tested positive to covid 19.  person in camp tested positive to covid 19.  required to isolate by at least 5 days required to isolate by at least 5 days

a wood employee tested positive for covid-19 			 a wood employee received a positive covid-19 test result on 07/22/2020.  the wood employee was experiencing symptoms and scheduled a covid 19 test which was a positive result.  contact tracing has been completed.			 wood management was notified and contact tracing was conducted.  there were no other wood or client employees identified.

category: slips & trips, eye injury or irritation
text: employee tripped on an uneven surface, fell to the ground hitting an i-beam laying on the ground caused a 2 inch laceration above left eye. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34480employee was walking on a swamp mat when he tripped on an uneven surface. as the employee fell to the ground the employee made contact with an i-beam that was laying on the ground. as a result of the fall, the employee received a 2 inch laceration above the left eye. axiom was notified. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee was observed looking pale and sweating. when questioned, complained of chest pain and was immediately taken to the local hospital  at around 11:15am, an employee was seen sitting at the reception area looking pale, sweating slightly and when questioned, complained of chest pains. he was immediately taken to the nearby hospital, accompanied by two staff members.  at the hospital, the duty doctor carried out an examination which included an ecg, and blood pressure. both were found to be normal.  the two staff members remained until the employees wife arrived at the hospital. he has been discharged from hospital and is at home resting.   he was immediately taken to the nearby hospital, accompanied by two staff members.

ip received first aid treatment to remove dust from eye. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34216ip receivedfirst aidtreatment to remove dust from eye. it is believed that the dust particle may have been on his safety glasses when he put them on.ip attended the medic who flushed dust from his eye using eye wash, he returned to work immediately. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

wood employee resulted positive from rt pcr test reference to the recent bcp activated in shallow water platform, a wood employee resulted positive from rt-pcr test conducted onsite. the ip is currently asymptomatic. the case is currently monitored by our oh team. ip is currently isolated. a close a contact was also identified. both are scheduled to be medevac'd today. the case was referred to the local government health team for coordination and recording. wood oh team is currently monitoring the situation.

ip was working on the north side of 3301,when he rooled his right ankle. ip was working underneath the hrsg 3301 on the north side. ip was giving instructions to his crew about what task to perform when he stepped off the concrete slab and rolled/twisted his right ankle. all work stopped, ip was escorted to the safety office for evaluation and seen by ineos emt. employee’s right ankle appeared to be swollen. ice pack was administered, employee was taken to the local on-site clinic for further evaluation. ip reported to wood safety ,ineos safety, job rep,the ip was escorted to the wood safety office and ineos emt came and checked his out. wood safety transported ip to the off site clinic for further evaluation.

2 x wires protruding out of a hole exposed whilst mechanical clearing whilst using a 360 excavator to clear bedrock, 2 x wires were exposed, these where coming out of the ground. (prior to commencement of the vgo project, the client had a contractor clear away a granite hillside with explosives and we believe that this remnants from this activity),  work stopped, area cleared and reported to project management. upon receipt of information the issue was reported to preem (the client), the area was barriered off and preem took control

employee walked under a suspended load. the pipe crew was tasked with hanging a 24” pipe inside of olefins 1 at the east-west pipe rack.  the crew was planning on using a jlg to install rigging on the pipe once the pipe was in position.  the jlg was parked directly under the suspended pipe.  as the employee was walking back to the jlg to get in the basket, he walked directly under the suspended pipe which was still hanging in the air (crane) waiting to get installed. the ineos construction coordinator was notified along with the ineos shift supervisor and additional ineos safety.
preventable, company vehicle, minor damage, no injury not provided not provided

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury
text: employee  working on a ladder fell to the floor the injured person (ip) was working off a 10 ft. metal ladder while removing an heating mat element. the ip was on 7th rung when the ladder tipped causing the ip to fall approximately 6 ft. to the ground.  the fall resulted in bruises and a head laceration requiring sutures.   complete check all ladders. all employees have been acquaintet with incident. check if all work at hight are executed in appriopriate way

1" airline cut into accidently while rerouting 1"waterline while in the process of rerouting a 1" waterline that was locked out a 1" airline located next to it was accidently cut into instead. ee stopped when air was released from the line. plant was notified and the airline was shut down and locked out so repairs could be made.

it came to light the rig should have not been in use following a hydraulic issue found when the rig was serviced following the previous incidents that have occurred with the window sample drilling rig the drillers have now let slip that the company that are employed to maintain the rig recommended that during the recent service that the rig should not be used due to the hydraulic system on the rig failing. the rig is to be removed from site and not used anymore. gts who employed the drilling rig have agreed to not use the company again.

category: slips & trips, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury
text: graebel employee was unloading gondola boxes and the boxes fell causing the ip to fall, the following is an excerpt from an email from don rupe with graebeldate of accident: 5/16/16nature of accident: fallnature of injury: leg fracture migrated from legacy cairs incident #30430worker with graebel moving company was unloading atruck in the parking lot of 17000 katy freeway (appaloosa building) location. excerpt from graebel incident report:driver was unloading commercial equipment from the cargo area of 24' box truck. approximately 20 large, empty corrugated containers (gondola boxes) were flat stacked against the side of the van and held in place with a cargo strap. the driver released the strap and was unable to hold the stack upright. while trying to evade the falling cartons, the driver was struck on the back of the lower leg causing a fall onto the floor of the van. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description
person in camp tested positive to covid 19  person in camp tested positive to covid 19.  required to isolate for at least 5 days. person required to isolate for at least 5 days.

gasket cutter broke resulting small cut to left hand palm. a worker was attempting to cut through a gasket with a gasket cutter, in the process; the blade of the cutting tool broke leaving a portion of the blade protruding from the tool. the workers hand continued to travel forward resulting in the blade shard penetrating the workers leather glove and causing a minor laceration to the left palm. worker immediately contacted his supervisor. worker was taken to aecon hsse. the worker was escorted to the onsite medical facility where the laceration was cleaned and a band aid applied. investigation initiated. the worker returned to regular duties.

wgs national employee detected and tested positive to covid 19 wgs national employee detected and tested positive to covid 19 , employee was isolated and following site doctor hould be evacuated for confinement at home . employee was isolated and following site doctor hould be evacuated for confinement at home .

category: slips & trips, hand or arm injury
text: fa; flynn; puncture left wrist; ks-2016-0057 ip was tasked with securing panelling. as ip was stabilizing siding with left arm and drilling a pilot hole through siding with right hand, the drill bit slipped striking ip on inside of left wrist causing a puncture. ip was wearing cut resistant gloves. work stopped and scene was frozen. ip was taken to onsite medic clinic for initial assessment but was referred to regina hospital where wound was cleaned and bandaged. post incident protocols followed. ip returned to full duties. investigation initiated.

category: mechanical or equipment issue, electric shock or issue
text: the electrical socket connected between office container and power generator found melted/ burnt  19th nov at approx 08.15, while arriving to work site team supervisor found the office container with no electricity. checking the power line he found electrical socket of the power cable melted/ burnt ( installed for power supply between office container and generator). the power line has been disconnected from the generator immediately.   by identifying the damaged electrical socket observer disconnected power cable from generator and informed all relative parties (duty electrician, site manager)

lost footing on stairs while descending  short stair case in engine room ip stepped of the final step and felt his right ankle twist as he placed his foot onto deck floor resulting in him stumbling over, vendor work mate who was infront of ip summoned  maersk mech tech in area who activated gpa  which resulted in full pob muster and er team and medic being deployed to scene. reported to medic

wood employee who had recently left the company entered the building through a faulty door to return it equipment. on monday 22nd june 2020, it was reported by the duart house landlord that a wood employee had tried to access the building on sunday 21st june using a deactivated card. the card did not allow access to the building however due to there being a fault with the door, they were able to enter the building allowing them to leave their it equipment at the reception area. the employees card had been deactivated as they had recently left the company. there is currently no security guard located within the building.  the fault with the door had been reported previously to the landlord and posters had been displayed to request individuals ensure the door is closed when leaving. a request had been made of the individual to contact their lead to arrange a date/time to arrange for the equipment to be dropped off however this request was not followed. a note has been sent to all contract leads to re-iterate that all leavers should be contacted to arrange a suitable date/time to allow them to drop off their it equipment. all individuals shall be escorted onto the building.

a wgpsn forklift driver found that he could not exit an area due to barriers that had been erected in relation to a nitrogen test. at no time was the driver or his vehicle inside the test exclusion zone. migrated from legacy cairs incident #28569a wgpsn forklift driver entered the process area in his forklift after signing onto his permit and being given a process area access key.on exiting the process area some time later the driver found that the route back to the vehicle parking area was blocked by barriers which had been erected some time after he had entered. the barriers had been erected as part of the preparation for a nitrogen test.at no time was the driver inside the test exclusion zone. the only restriction was that he could not return his vehicle to the nominated storage area as the route had been blocked off by barriers. the driver parked his vehicle in an alternativesafe area and walked back to the esb to report the incident.when returning to theprocess area after break the driver met some wgpsn pipe fitters who had found that the pedestrian route to the worksite they had been working on previously had been blocked by a barrier which they did not pass. it was after speaking to these pipefitters the driver decided to remove the forklift from the process area as is normal practice after which he encountered the previously mentioned barriers. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

while walking to lunch ie experienced ankle discomfort ee states that while walking from crane to go to lunch he rolled his right ankle due to uneven ground conditions. ee has had personal ongoing chronic issues with the same ankle and has been under medical care with his own physician. first aid offered

one wood employee tested positive for covid 19 during facility screening test.  one wood employee tested positive for covid 19 during facility screening testing. ee is asymptomatic and is isolated on the facility. contact tracing is complete.  ee was isolated on facility.

individual was travelling to site from sella ness camp and cut his finger on the seat belt buckle. on sunday 21st april at 06:55 a wood employee was travelling from sella ness camp to site on one of the site buses. as he sat down and donned his seat belt he cut his finger on a sharp piece of plastic on the buckle. an arriving at site he informed the bus driver of the defect and report to the site medic who cleaned the wound and applied a plaster. the individual reported this incident on a observation card. individual reported defect to bus driver, visited medic and reported incident to his supervisor. this incident has been shared with enquest hse team.
struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was using a bandsaw to trim meat from a bone. the blade amputated his left index finger.
injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was segregating metal at the recycling shop when he cut his thumb with metal shears, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet on 3/5/15 around noon, an employee fell approximately 8' from a ladder when the ductwork he was releasing swung down, hit the ladder, and rocked it. the employee sustained two left arm fractures (wrist and elbow) and a possible pelvis fracture. the employee was transported to ecmc where he was treated and released.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment on february 13, 2021, an employee was working to unjam a pelletizer machine when their finger was caught by an auger blade and partially amputated. the machine had been turned off, and a guard was open at the time of the incident.

text: caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee performing maintenance on a forklift was removing the hydraulic cylinder from the mast, which was elevated on spacer blocks. when the cylinder was removed, it struck the spacer block, causing the inside rail to lower. the employee's left hand was pinned between the inside and outside rails of the forklift, resulting in a crush injury and a laceration between the knuckles and wrist.

category: slips & trips, hand or arm injury

text: pedestrian struck by vehicle backing up in nonroadway area an employee was stepping off a stand-up forklift truck when another employee reversing a sit-down forklift struck the employee. the employee suffered a broken pelvis and was hospitalized.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was moving a snow plow blade from a pallet. the blade slipped and smashed the employee's left middle finger against the pallet. the end of the finger was amputated.
fall on same level due to tripping, unspecified an employee tripped and fell while leaving work, suffering a broken hip.

text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was using an overhead crane to move a 3/8" thick, 3' x 10' piece of steel plate. there was a chain on the crane hook, which was attached to an eye bolt for moving the steel plate. the steel plate came off the crane hook, bounced off of a bench, and struck the employee in the leg. the employee was hospitalized with a broken leg and had surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified on january 24, 2018, an employee was attempting to remove a part from a packaging robot when the employee's finger was caught in the spin line's point of operation, amputating the fingertip.

caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified on 5/21/2018, an employee was inside an aerial lift and raising it when the employee's right hand became pinched, causing a laceration that resulted in a right pinky finger amputation.

category: hand or arm injury, lifting or moving loads, dropped object or material, vehicle incident general
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was trying to move a trailer off the assembly line with help from coworkers. the trailer slid sideways and fell off its dolly. when the trailer hit the floor, the open tilt deck slammed shut onto the injured employee's left hand, severely lacerating it.

shooting by other person-intentional after an employee ìthe shooterî from another company shot and killed a colleague, he shot an employee as he tried to make his escape.  a second employee attempted to subdue the shooter and was assaulted.

category: slips & trips, head or face injury
text: fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking to their car after work, slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell. the employee struck their head on the ground and suffered a concussion.
struck by swinging part of powered vehicle while an employee was getting out of a car, the car door slammed on and partially amputated the employee's pinky.

struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee shut down a mixer and was reaching inside when the mixer amputated his left ring finger. the mixer had not come to a complete stop at the time of the incident.

text: inhalation of harmful substance-single episode an employee suffered an allergic reaction to the avocado in a coworker's guacamole, requiring hospitalization.

category: lifting or moving loads, foot or leg injury
text: struck by swinging or slipping object, other than handheld, n.e.c. on april 8, 2021, an employee was operating a crane when its load shifted and struck the employee. the employee suffered a broken leg and was hospitalized.

struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was pushing a snow blower and struck something that was under the snow causing the snow blower to flip and strike the employee resulting in a back injury.

direct exposure to electricity, greater than 220 volts an employee was doing electrical work at a remote worksite. the employee came into contact with a downed primary electrical wire and was shocked. the employee suffered hand injuries and was hospitalized.

contact with objects and equipment, unspecified employees use a draw machine to extrude wire.  the employee bypassed the guard or disabled it to remove soap build-up on the wire coming from the die. the employee amputated the middle, ring, and pinky fingers on the right hand and the first digit of the index finger. employee was hospitalized and released. the injury occurred on 1/3/15 at approximately 6:00 p.m.
caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee's left index fingertip was amputated by a power press.

jack-knifed or overturned, nonroadway an employee was riding in the basket of a scissor lift that was rigged with a steel beam when the lift toppled over. the employee suffered four broken ribs and was hospitalized.

text: other fall to lower level 11 to 15 feet  an employee was removing snow from the roof of one story house and fell to the ground. the employee sustained a skull fracture and injured his spleen and shoulder.
gored or rammed by animal a cow pinned an employee against a fence in a livestock yard alleyway. the cow's horn punctured the right side of the employee's stomach.
struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was using a saw to cut blocks when his right hand contacted the blade, amputating three fingers and pinching his thumb.

exposure through intact skin, eyes, or other exposed tissue an employee was filling a container with sodium hydroxide when the sodium hydroxide splashed out of the container onto the employee, resulting in chemical burns.

category: slips & trips, hand or arm injury
text: struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was cutting frozen meat when the meat slipped out of their hand and the tips of their middle and index fingers were amputated by the band saw.

caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified an employee was working on the chain and pulley of an overhead door when the chain hooked to the employee's glove and pulled his hand onto the sprocket. he sustained a couple of broken left-hand fingers and damage to the nerve and veins.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was cleaning and lubricating the drive chain on a pipe coating machine. the rag he was using to remove excess oil was caught in the machine, which resulted in his hand being pulled in. he suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger.

climbing or stepping up or down-single episode an employee had placed one foot on a pallet, about 3 inches above the floor, to retrieve banded cardboard. when the employee turned and stepped down, they twisted and broke their ankle. the employee was hospitalized, requiring pins in their ankle. low-cut shoes, not boots, were being worn at the time of the incident.

category: hand or arm injury, lifting or moving loads, dropped object or material, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part on april 18, 2019, an employee was removing a dent in a tank using a hydraulic jack and pipe assembly with a saddle. the pipe at one end came loose and fell on the employee's left hand, causing a crushing injury. the employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

struck by dislodged flying object, particle two employees had just finished installing a replacement spindle motor for a cnc machine. the employees started the motor up. as it was coming up to speed, the bottom flange that holds the motor failed and fragments flew through the air striking both employees on their right legs.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury

fall on same level due to tripping over an object  on february 5, 2015 an employee working at the genesis community center tripped over a curb in the parking lot suffering a dislocated shoulder.  the employee was hospitalized due to the severity of the injury.

category: vehicle incident general, head or face injury
text: pedestrian struck by forward-moving vehicle in work zone  an employee was inspecting highway work when a passenger vehicle entered the work zone and struck his parked vehicle. the employee was pinned between his vehicle and a concrete barrier, suffering head trauma. he was hospitalized.

intentional injury by other person, n.e.c. a client threw a fire extinguisher at an employee. a second employee attempted to block it and got hit by the fire extinguisher, sustaining a back injury. both employees were hospitalized.

struck against moving part of machinery or equipment on 3/01/2021, an employee was cutting a piece of wood using a table saw when a kickback occurred, resulting in a partial amputation of the left thumb.

category: line strike, head or face injury
text: struck by swinging or slipping object, other than handheld, n.e.c. an employee was cutting and removing a fallen tree and was pinning down the power line and communication cables. as the tree was being cut and removed, the communication cable sprang up and struck the employee in the face. the employee was hospitalized with facial injuries.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was cutting a chamfer on the edge of the concrete curb with a cut-off saw. the curb broke and pinched the blade which caused the cut-off saw to kick back and cut the employee's shoulder/armpit area.
struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was admitted to the hospital with several broken bones after being struck by a pole that was not securely rigged.

caught in running equipment or machinery, n.e.c. a mechanical engineer technician was upgrading a load bearing machine from manual to automatic when his glove and right index finger got caught between the sprocket and chain. the right index fingertip was amputated.

category: slips & trips, lifting or moving loads
text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was walking beside a crane, lost his balance, and slipped in the mud.  he couldn't get out of the way and was run over by the crane's wheels, damaging both legs. the employee was hospitalized; the extent of damage was unknown at the time of reporting.

text: struck or run over by rolling powered vehicle the employee jump started a tandem axle truck. after getting it started, he went back to put the battery covers on the batteries and the truck rolled forward. the first set of tandem rear wheels ran over the employee fracturing ribs and the right foot. the employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair the injuries.

contact with hot objects or substances an employee was trying to repair a leaking valve on a pipeline that delivered milk product to a milk carton filling machine. a spray of steam came out of the filling machine, contacting his right hand, face, and neck. he suffered second-degree burns to the right hand and his right side.

text: caught in running equipment or machinery, n.e.c. an employee was assisting in a test of a new pan line that was being installed when he was struck by a pan on the line and sustained a broken right hand.
fall on same level due to slipping  on january 16, 2017, at approximately 3:30 p.m., an employee slipped on ice and fell. the employee was hospitalized for a concussion and bleeding on the brain.

fall on same level due to slipping  on march 8, 2018, at approximately 11:00 am, while picking up trash at a restaurant, an employee slipped and fell onto ice, fracturing a hip and requiring hospitalization.
